A student is trying to determine the heat of reaction for the acid-base neutralization reaction represented above. The student uses 0.50 M NaOH and 0.50 M HCl solutions. Which of the following situations, by itself, would most likely result in the LEAST error in the calculated value of the heat of reaction?
choicesHtml: The thermometer was incorrectly calibrated and read 0.5 Celsius degree too high during the procedure.
The volume of the acid solution added to the calorimeter was actually 1.0 mL less than what was recorded.
The calorimeter was poorly insulated, and some heat escaped to the atmosphere during the procedure.
The actual molarity of the base solution was 0.53 M but was recorded as 0.50 M.
